name: Top-Down Causation via Energy Injection
description: The ability of a higher-level controller to stabilize a state that is unstable under local dynamics by injecting energy or information (breaking symmetry) to override local entropy.
findings: In a high-noise environment (eta=2.0), a Vicsek Swarm naturally collapses to disorder (Order ~0.08).
A Meta-Controller applying a 'Downward Constraint' (External Field) can stabilize significant order (Order ~0.65).
Effective Top-Down Causation requires 'Symmetry Breaking' (forcing a specific direction) rather than just reinforcing the noisy mean.
High Gain (Energy Injection) is required to overcome the local bandwidth limits of the substrate.
implications: The 'Ghost in the Machine' is not just a passive observer but an active source of negentropy.
Meta-Control allows for 'Impossible States' to exist.
This validates the Federated Architecture of NRM vNext.
